page.title: 01COCKAYNE'S FARM, PLUMTREE.
page.content: Altogether the farm covers 360 acres and the buildings cover about 1 acre. The farm itself is over 200 years old. There are three people working on the farm. Mr Cockayne employs 1 person. He has about 100 cows, there are three types Redpoles, Jersey and Guernsey. Mr Cockayne is a dairy and beef farmer. He uses machines to milk the cows at 6.00 am and 4.00 pm. The milk is stored in tankers. Then a milk tanker comes daily and takes it to the CO-OP. Mr Cockayne does not buy cows but he breeds them. When the cows get fat he sells them to the cattle market. He grows Wheat, Barley, Sugarbeet and grass for grazing.The Sugarbeet goes to the British Sugar Corperation, Newark.Mr Cockayne rotates his fields.In each field he grows Corn for 3 years then grass for 4 years,then Sugarbeet for 3 years.
